dublin_core.dcvalue: This study applied a 6 month educational intervention that used the technology of the short message service via cellular phones and the Internet for obese patients with type 2 diabetes Eighteen patients were randomly assigned to an intervention group and 16 were assigned to a control group N 34 Patients in the intervention group were asked to access a web site by using personal cellular phones or computer Internet services to input their blood glucose levels daily Participants were then sent optimal recommendations via cellular phone and the Internet weekly After 6 months the intervention group had a statistically significant decrease in glycosylated hemoglobin fasting plasma glucose 2 hour postmeal glucose and total cholesterol as compared with the control group
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T17:00:25Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2008-05-06
Technological intervention for obese patients with type 2 diabetes.
